title: Credit Card statute of limitations in Virginia
question: I have an issue with a credit card balance claimed. There is no signed contract, only a pre-approved certificate for a secured credit card account. What is the statute of limitations?
answers: Three years, per Virginia Code Annotated, Section 8.01-246 (4). Debt collection lawyers make this error with some frequency as to Capital One accounts.

STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS FOR ENFORCEMENT:


Open Account (credit card): 4 years (2 yeas if not in writing)
Written Contract: 4 years
Domestic Judgment: 10 years (can be renewed at 10 years)
Foreign Judgment: 10 years
